content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata> <idinfo> <citation> <citeinfo> <origin> Government of Canada, Natural Resources Canada, Canada Centre for Remote Sensing, The Atlas of Canada </origin> <origin>Instituto Nacional de Estad\ufffd\ufffdstica Geograf\ufffd\ufffda e Inform\ufffd\ufffdtica</origin> <origin>U.S. Geological Survey</origin> <pubdate>200406</pubdate> <title>North American Atlas - Railroads - Direct Download</title> <geoform>Vector digital data</geoform> <pubinfo> <pubplace>Ottawa, Ontario, Canada</pubplace> <publish>Government of Canada</publish> </pubinfo> <pubinfo> <pubplace>Aguascalientes, Aguascalientes, Mexico</pubplace> <publish>Instituto Nacional de Estad\ufffd\ufffdstica, Geograf\ufffd\ufffda e Inform\ufffd\ufffdtica (INEGI)</publish> </pubinfo> <pubinfo> <pubplace>Reston, Virginia, USA</pubplace> <publish>U.S. Geological Survey</publish> </pubinfo> <onlink>http://dds.cr.usgs.gov/pub/data/nationalatlas/rail00l_shp_nt00306.tar.gz</onlink> <onlink>http://geogratis.cgdi.gc.ca/download/frameworkdata/North_America_Atlas10M/railroads/</onlink><onlink>http://antares.inegi.gob.mx/atlas_norteamerica/</onlink> <onlink>http://nationalatlas.gov/atlasftp.html</onlink> </citeinfo> </citation> <descript> <abstract> A joint venture involving the National Atlas programs in Canada (Natural Resources Canada), Mexico (Instituto Nacional de Estad\ufffd\ufffdstica Geograf\ufffd\ufffda e Inform\ufffd\ufffdtica), and the United States (U.S. Geological Survey), as well as the North American Commission for Environmental Co-operation, has led to the release (June 2004) of several new products: an updated paper map of North America, and its associated geospatial data sets and their metadata. These data sets are available online from each of the partner countries both for visualization and download.  The North American Atlas data are standardized geospatial data sets at 1:10,000,000 scale.  A variety of basic data layers (e.g. roads, railroads, populated places, political boundaries, hydrography, bathymetry, sea ice and glaciers) have been integrated so that their relative positions are correct.  This collection of data sets forms a base with which other North American thematic data may be integrated.  Any data outside of Canada, Mexico, and the United States of America included in the North American Atlas data sets is strictly to complete the context of the data.  The North American Atlas - Railroads data set shows the railroads of North America at 1:10,000,000 scale.  The railroads selected for this data set are either rail links between major centres of population or major resource railways.  There is no classification of rail lines.  This data set was produced using digital files supplied by Natural Resources Canada, Instituto Nacional de Estad\ufffd\ufffdstica Geograf\ufffd\ufffda e Inform\ufffd\ufffdtica, and the U.S. Geological Survey. </abstract> <purpose> The North American Atlas data are intended for geographic display and analysis at the national and continental level.  These data should be displayed and analyzed at scales appropriate for 1:10,000,000-scale data. No responsibility is assumed by Natural Resources Canada, Instituto Nacional de Estad\ufffd\ufffdstica Geograf\ufffd\ufffda e Inform\ufffd\ufffdtica, or the U.S. Geological Survey in the use of these data. </purpose> <supplinf> The Commission for Environmental Cooperation (CEC) is an international organization created by Canada, Mexico, and the United States of America under the North American Agreement on Environmental Cooperation (NAAEC). The CEC was established to address regional environmental concerns, help prevent potential trade and environmental conflicts, and to promote the effective enforcement of environmental law.  The Agreement complements the environmental provisions of the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA).  Further information on the CEC is available from http://www.cec.org/ or from >Commission for Environmental Cooperation >393, rue St-Jacques Ouest >Bureau 200 >Montr\ufffd\ufffdal (Qu\ufffd\ufffdbec) >H2Y 1N9 Canada > >Telephone: 514 350 4300 >Facsimile: 514 350 4314 >Electronic mail: info@ccemtl.org > All North American Atlas data sets are available in four data formats: Arc/INFO Export format (e00), ArcView Shapefile, Geography Markup Language (GML) and Spatial Data Transfer Standard (SDTS).  Although these data are distributed in geographic coordinates, the North American Atlas Map uses a Lambert Azimuthal Equal Area projection.  The following parameters were used for the map: >Longitude_of_Projection_Center: -100.00 >Latitude_of_Projection_Center: 45.00 >False_Easting (metres): 0.0 >False_Northing (metres): 0.0 >Semi-major_Axis: 6370997.0 >Denominator_of_Flattening_Ratio: 1.0 >Ellipsoid_Name: Sphere >Units: metres </supplinf> </descript> <timeperd> <timeinfo> <sngdate> <caldate>200406</caldate> </sngdate> </timeinfo> <current>Publication date</current> </timeperd> <status> <progress>Complete</progress> <update>Irregular</update> </status> <spdom> <bounding> <westbc>152.0</westbc> <eastbc>4.0</eastbc> <northbc>90.0</northbc> <southbc>-5.0</southbc> </bounding> </spdom> <keywords> <theme> <themekt>None</themekt> <themekey>Infrastructure</themekey> <themekey>Transportation</themekey> <themekey>Railway network</themekey> <themekey>Railroad network</themekey> <themekey>Rail transportation</themekey> <themekey>Railway</themekey> <themekey>Railroad</themekey> </theme> <place> <placekt>None</placekt> <placekey>Mid-latitude</placekey> <placekey>Western Hemisphere</placekey> <placekey>Northern Hemisphere</placekey> <placekey>North America</placekey> <placekey>NAFTA</placekey> <placekey>North America Free Trade Agreement</placekey> <placekey>Canada</placekey> <placekey>Mexico</placekey> <placekey>United States</placekey> </place> </keywords> <accconst>None</accconst> <useconst> All data for Canada and other areas outside of Mexico and the United States of America are covered by the Geogratis User Agreement for Digital Data; see http://geogratis.cgdi.gc.ca/e_license.html.  No use constraints are applied to data for Mexico and the United States of America.  Acknowledgment of the North American Atlas, Instituto Nacional de Estad\ufffd\ufffdstica Geograf\ufffd\ufffda e Inform\ufffd\ufffdtica, Natural Resources Canada, and (or) the U.S. Geological Survey would be appreciated in products derived from these data. </useconst> <ptcontac> <cntinfo> <cntorgp> <cntorg> Government of Canada, Natural Resources Canada, Canada Centre for Remote Sensing, The Atlas of Canada </cntorg> </cntorgp> <cntpos>Atlas of Canada Client Services</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype>Mailing address</addrtype> <address>Room 650-615 Booth Street</address> <city>Ottawa</city> <state>Ontario</state> <postal>K1A 0E9</postal> <country>Canada</country> </cntaddr> <cntfax>+01 613 947 2410</cntfax> <cntemail>info@atlas.gc.ca</cntemail> </cntinfo> </ptcontac> <ptcontac> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>Jorge Padilla Noriega</cntper> <cntorg>Direcci\ufffd\ufffdn General de Geograf\ufffd\ufffda, INEGI</cntorg> </cntperp> <cntaddr> <addrtype>Mailing address</addrtype> <address>Av Heroe de Nacozari Sur 2301</address> <address>Fracc Jardines del Parque</address> <city>Aguascalientes</city> <state>Aguascalientes</state> <postal>20270</postal> <country>Mexico</country> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>52 449 910 5349</cntvoice> <cntemail>jorge.padilla@inegi.gob.mx</cntemail> </cntinfo> </ptcontac> <ptcontac> <cntinfo> <cntorgp> <cntorg>U.S. Geological Survey</cntorg> <cntper>John Hutchinson</cntper> </cntorgp> <cntaddr> <addrtype>Mailing address</addrtype> <address>USGS EROS Data Center</address> <city>Sioux Falls</city> <state>South Dakota</state> <postal>57198-0001</postal> <country>USA</country> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>605 594 6049</cntvoice> <cntfax>605 594 6529</cntfax> <cntemail>atlasmail@usgs.gov</cntemail> </cntinfo> </ptcontac> </idinfo> <dataqual> <attracc> <attraccr> Where possible, attribute data were quality controlled by creating symbolized digital displays or hard copy plots, which were visually verified with digital or hard copy reference data.  Attribute data that could not be verified in such a manner were interactively queried to check for anomalies such as duplication of data in fields requiring unique values and incorrect feature coding.  Data for areas outside of Canada, Mexico, and the United States of America are only provided for context; Natural Resources Canada, Instituto Nacional de Estad\ufffd\ufffdstica Geograf\ufffd\ufffda e Inform\ufffd\ufffdtica, and the U.S. Geological Survey assume no responsibility for the completeness, accuracy, or presentation of this data. </attraccr> </attracc> <logic> A quality control of the linear railroad data was done in order to ensure topological consistency within each country and across country boundaries. </logic> <complete> This data set includes railroads for all of North America as shown at 1:10,000,000 scale.  The data completeness reflects the content of the source data, the selection made by the cartographers, and the quality control of the content performed by each country. </complete> <posacc> <horizpa> <horizpar> Positional accuracy varies throughout the data.  Positions are dependent on the accuracy of the source data and on the result of the generalization and integration processes.  Data for areas outside of Canada, Mexico, and the United States of America are only provided for context; Natural Resources Canada, Instituto Nacional de Estad\ufffd\ufffdstica Geograf\ufffd\ufffda e Inform\ufffd\ufffdtica, and the U.S. Geological Survey assume no responsibility for the completeness, accuracy, or presentation of this data. </horizpar> </horizpa> </posacc> <lineage> <srcinfo> </srcinfo> <procstep> <procdesc> Linework from the 1:6,000,000 Atlas of Canada railroad network was generalized and fitted to the North American Atlas hydrography, roads and populated places layers.  The 1:1,000,000 National Scale Frameworks Rail Network, Canada was used as a supplement to check selection and position.  The attribute for the country was added to the data. </procdesc> <srcused>6M CA Rail</srcused> <srcused>CA Frameworks Rail</srcused> <srcused>NAA Hydro</srcused> <srcused>NAA Roads</srcused> <srcused>NAA Places</srcused> <procdate>2003</procdate> </procstep> <procstep> <procdesc> Linework from the 1:5,000,000 United States General Reference Map was generalized and fitted to the North American Atlas hydrography, roads and populated places layers.  The attribute for the country was added to the data. </procdesc> <srcused>5M USA Rails</srcused> <srcused>NAA Hydro</srcused> <srcused>NAA Roads</srcused> <srcused>NAA Places</srcused> <procdate>2003</procdate> </procstep> <procstep> <procdesc> Linework from the 1:4,000,000 Topographical Dataset for Mexico was generalized and fitted to the North American Atlas hydrography, roads and populated places layers.  The attribute for the country was added to the data. </procdesc> <srcused>4M Mexico</srcused> <srcused>NAA Hydro</srcused> <srcused>NAA Roads</srcused> <srcused>NAA Places</srcused> <procdate>2003</procdate> </procstep> <procstep> <procdesc> The files from the three countries were combined and the railroad lines were cartographically adjusted along country boundaries to ensure correct connection of the railroad network. </procdesc> <procdate>2003</procdate> </procstep> <procstep> <procdesc> Because the linework came from several different sources and scales, a final cartographic review was done to the full railroad network to ensure cartographic compatibility at 1:10,000,000 scale.  Each country then performed a final cartographic check to verify the selection and position of the linework.  The attributes were also verified. </procdesc> <procdate>2004</procdate> </procstep> </lineage> </dataqual> <spdoinfo> <direct>Vector</direct> <ptvctinf> <sdtsterm> <sdtstype>Complete chain</sdtstype> <ptvctcnt>1114</ptvctcnt> </sdtsterm> </ptvctinf> </spdoinfo> <spref> <horizsys> <geograph> <latres>0.000001</latres> <longres>0.000001</longres> <geogunit>Decimal degrees</geogunit> </geograph> <geodetic> <horizdn>North American Datum of 1983</horizdn> <ellips>Geodetic Reference System 80</ellips> <semiaxis>6378137.000000</semiaxis> <denflat>298.257222</denflat> </geodetic> </horizsys> </spref> <eainfo> <detailed> <enttyp> <enttypl>Railroad</enttypl> <enttypd>A set of parallel rails on which a train runs.</enttypd> <enttypds>North American Atlas GIS Group</enttypds> </enttyp> <attr> <attrlabl>UIDENT</attrlabl> <attrdef> The unique identifier.  A unique number that is assigned to each feature in the North American Atlas data.
